ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DATA=CAS-libref.data-table | CHILD=CAS-libref.data-table | DISDATA=CAS-libref.data-table 
      
Specifies the input data table that contains the forecast of the time series that represent the 
children nodes in the hierarchy. Typically, the CHILD= data table is generated by an OUTFOR= data 
collector object of the TSMODEL procedure. The dimensions of the CHILD= data table are greater than 
the dimensions of the PARENT= data table. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref 
refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

Syntax: PARENT=CAS-libref.data-table | AGGDATA=CAS-libref.data-table
      
Specifies the input data table that contains the forecasts of the time series that represent the parent 
nodes in the hierarchy. Typically, the PARENT= data table is generated by an OUTFOR= data collector object
of the TSMODEL procedure. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib 
and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

The PARENT= data table must contain a proper subset, possibly empty, of the BY variables that are present 
in the CHILD= data table.

Syntax: OUTFOR=CAS-libref.data-table
      
Specifies the name of the output data table in which to store the reconciled values. CAS-libref.data-table 
is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies 
the name of the input data table.

Syntax: AGGREGATE=SUM | AVERAGE
      
Specifies whether the dependent variable in the PARENT= data table is the total sum or the average over 
the BY groups of the dependent variable in the CHILD= data table. By default, AGGREGATE=SUM.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the dependent variable in the PARENT= data table is a total sum.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that the dependent variable in the PARENT= data table is an avarage.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ALPHA=α
      
Specifies the level of the confidence limits when CLMETHOD=GAUSSIAN, where α must be between 0.0001 and 
0.9999. The upper and lower confidence limits will have a 1 - α confidence level. By default, ALPHA=0.05, 
which produces 95% confidence intervals.

Syntax: CLMETHOD=SHIFT | GAUSSIAN
      
Specifies which method to use to compute confidence limits for the reconciled forecasts.

By default, CLMETHOD=SHIFT.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Computes the confidence intervals by re-centering the original confidence intervals around the new forecasts.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Computes the confidence intervals by assuming that the forecasts are approximately Gaussian.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DISAGGREGATION=option | LOSS=option
      
Specifies the type of disaggregation method and type of loss function for top-down reconciliation.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Bases the loss function on the root mean squared error (RMSE), which results in adjustments that  are the (possibly weighted) mean difference of the aggregated child nodes and the parent node.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Uses a loss function that results in reconciled forecasts that are the (possibly weighted) proportional  disaggregation of the parent node.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that a value of 0 for the Predict variable in the CHILD= data table implies a value of 0 
for the corresponding observation in the OUTFOR= data table.

Syntax: SIGN=option
      
Specifies the sign in the reconciled series. By default, SIGN=MIXED.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that the output series can have any sign.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specify that the output series is nonnegative.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies that the output series is nonpositive.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Weights the loss function for top-down reconciliation by the inverse of the variance of the input forecasts.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CHILDROLES <options>;

The CHILDROLES statement enables you to specify names for forecasting variables in the CHILD= data table.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ACTUAL=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in theCHILD= data table that contains the actual values. 
By default, ACTUAL=ACTUAL.

Syntax: PREDICT=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the predicted values. 
By default, PREDICT=PREDICT.

Syntax: LOWER=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the lower confidence limit 
values. By default, LOWER=LOWER.

Syntax: UPPER=variable-name 
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the upper confidence limit 
values. By default, UPPER=UPPER.

Syntax: ERROR=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the error values. 
By default, ERROR=ERROR.

Syntax: STD=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the standard error values. 
By default, STD=STD.

Syntax: END=option
          
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the date at which the reconciliation ends. 
If the largest variable value is less than the END= value, this option has no effect.

Syntax: START=option 
          
Specifies a SAS date, datetime, or time value that represents the variable value at which the reconciliation 
begins. This option can be used to limit the reconciliation process only to forecasts that are outside the 
historical period.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PARENTROLES <options>;

The PARENTROLES statement enables you to specify custom names for forecasting variables in the PARENT= data table.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ACTUAL=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the actual values. 
By default, ACTUAL=ACTUAL.

Syntax: PREDICT=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the CHILD= data table that contains the predicted values. 
By default, PREDICT=PREDICT.

Syntax: LOWER=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the  PARENT= data table that contains the lower confidence 
limit values. By default, LOWER=LOWER.

Syntax: UPPER=variable-name 
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the upper confidence 
limit values. By default, UPPER=UPPER.

Syntax: ERROR=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the error values. 
By default, ERROR=ERROR.

Syntax: STD=variable-name
          
Specifies the name of the variable in the PARENT= data table that contains the standard error values. 
By default, STD=STD.
